title: How to check the real broadband internet speed - Quora

response.answer_text: If you look at your modem’s web page you should be able to find a table that contains information like this: Downstream/Upstream SNR Margin: 3.6/8.5db Line Attenuation: 33.4/20.3db Data Rate: 14333/998kbps Max Rate: 15856/998kbps POWER: 19.3/12.0dbm CRC: 4175/6 This is from my modem. It is early morning so there should be no other activity in my household: Ookla Speedtest (using my ISP’s wholesale provider’s server): ping 28ms, jitter 11ms, download 11 800kbps, upload 850kbps. You can see there is quite a bit of difference between the maximum data rate estimated by the modem and the measured data rate.

Internet service providers all around the world talk a good game when it comes to promising you a lightning-fast broadband speeds and downloads that are complete in mere moments. But if it feels like your internet connection isn't as sprightly as you’d hoped, then you can test it using My Fiber internet speed test. Here’s how to check your broadband speed:  Visit my fiber website from the chrome browser and click on the start button to begin the test, within seconds you will get your accurate speed test results appearing in terms of download speed, upload speed, and your ISP name. I hope this will help you.
